intro: Phyllanthus hirtellus var. parviflorus, commonly known as the small-flowered milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and covered with fine hairs. The small, yellowish flowers are arranged in complex cupular structures, typical of the genus.
